trans-unit.source: REST and Brokered Messaging Programming Lifecycle
trans-unit.target: REST and Brokered Messaging Programming Lifecycle

trans-unit.source: <token>sb2</token> queues are first-in, first-out, durable lists of messages that you can use to build messaging applications that are not tightly coupled to a particular time or component, enabling all kinds of applications to participate in loosely coupled and robust distributed applications.
trans-unit.target: <token>sb2</token> queues are first-in, first-out, durable lists of messages that you can use to build messaging applications that are not tightly coupled to a particular time or component, enabling all kinds of applications to participate in loosely coupled and robust distributed applications.

trans-unit.source: The development lifecycle mirrors that of the <link xlink:href="680a23d3-efb1-4be0-8feb-e552bcaf5eb3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">REST lifecycle for the message buffer</link>, as you do not have to create a REST-style <token>indigo1</token> service contract in order to send a message.
trans-unit.target: The development lifecycle mirrors that of the <link xlink:href="680a23d3-efb1-4be0-8feb-e552bcaf5eb3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">REST lifecycle for the message buffer</link>, as you do not have to create a REST-style <token>indigo1</token> service contract in order to send a message.

trans-unit.source: Creating a queue, a topic, or a subscription to a topic, or sending a message to or from one of these resources requires only the appropriate credentials for the specific action and the appropriate URI for the resource you want to create, delete, or use.
trans-unit.target: Creating a queue, a topic, or a subscription to a topic, or sending a message to or from one of these resources requires only the appropriate credentials for the specific action and the appropriate URI for the resource you want to create, delete, or use.

trans-unit.source: The basic lifecycle is as follows, and is completely implemented in a simple example in the <link xlink:href="f7d20929-7619-41a7-9566-a573ded763ff" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Bus Brokered Messaging REST Tutorial</link>.
trans-unit.target: The basic lifecycle is as follows, and is completely implemented in a simple example in the <link xlink:href="f7d20929-7619-41a7-9566-a573ded763ff" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Bus Brokered Messaging REST Tutorial</link>.

trans-unit.source: Obtain a Shared Access Signature (SAS) token.
trans-unit.target: Obtain a Shared Access Signature (SAS) token.

trans-unit.source: You use the token to gain access to your <token>sb2</token> <token>servicensd</token> resources.
trans-unit.target: You use the token to gain access to your <token>sb2</token> <token>servicensd</token> resources.

trans-unit.source: SAS authentication enables applications to authenticate to <token>sb2</token> using an access key configured on the namespace, or on the messaging entity with which specific rights are associated.
trans-unit.target: SAS authentication enables applications to authenticate to <token>sb2</token> using an access key configured on the namespace, or on the messaging entity with which specific rights are associated.

trans-unit.source: You can then use this key to generate a SAS token that clients can use to authenticate to <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: You can then use this key to generate a SAS token that clients can use to authenticate to <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: Create the resources you want to use.
trans-unit.target: Create the resources you want to use.

trans-unit.source: For example, you might create a queue or a topic.
trans-unit.target: For example, you might create a queue or a topic.

trans-unit.source: If a topic in which you are interested already exists, you can create a subscription to that topic, add a filter, and so on.
trans-unit.target: If a topic in which you are interested already exists, you can create a subscription to that topic, add a filter, and so on.

trans-unit.source: Send messages to a queue or a topic.
trans-unit.target: Send messages to a queue or a topic.

trans-unit.source: Retrieve messages from a queue or a subscription.
trans-unit.target: Retrieve messages from a queue or a subscription.

trans-unit.source: If needed, delete the queue, topic, or subscription whose resources you want to enable <token>sb2</token> to reclaim.
trans-unit.target: If needed, delete the queue, topic, or subscription whose resources you want to enable <token>sb2</token> to reclaim.
